Key Match Events: Bangladesh lost wickets in quick succession, including Shakib Al Hasan, Mehidy Hasan Miraz, and Mustafizur Rahim, with just 70 runs to show for it.
Mahmudullah and Mahedi Hasan stitched a gritty 38-run stand which was eventually broken by a brilliant direct throw by De Leede to send Mahedy back to the pavilion.
Taskin Ahmed struck to claim his second wicket of the day, followed by Mustafizur and Taskin putting in a brave effort, scoring 20 and 11 respectively but couldn’t guide their side over the line.
Pre-Game Insights: After winning the toss, Edwards opted to bat first in Kolkata.
The Dutch got off to a horrendous start, losing both openers Max O’Dowd and Vikramjit Singh in the first three overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Following this win, Netherlands will take on Afghanistan at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow on November 3.
With this win, Netherlands moved up to the eighth spot in the World Cup 2023 points table, sending defending champions England to the bottom.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh slipped behind the Dutch in the points table, and into ninth position.
Netherlands ended Bangladesh’s hopes of qualifying for the semi-finals in the ongoing ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 by handing them an 87-run defeat at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata.
Others: Shoriful Islam, Mahedi Hasan, Taskin and Mustafizur all picked two wickets each.
Logan van Beek remained unbeaten on 23 runs off 16 balls but wickets kept tumbling around him as Bangladesh bowled Netherlands out for 229 runs.
